text:
domain, more complex lithostratigraphic successions are recorded because early felsic volcanism 
 in  distinct  centres  developed  at  the  same  time  as  the  regionally  extensive  komatiite  volcanic 
 flows. These units generally trend north-east, and prominent structural lineations in the form of 
 shear zones trend northwesterly. The Boorara Domain is a tectono-stratigraphic domain of the 
 highly economic Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane, Archaean Yilgarn Craton, 
 Western Australia. 
 Work carried out by Jackson Gold Ltd during the reporting period included a project review, 
 data  compliation  and  a  reconnaissance  field  visit  (Table  1).  The  exploration  index  plan  is 
 presented in Figure 2.

12.text: basin formed between 2.72 Ga and 2.68 Ga, and is characterised by a regional lithostratigraphy

text:
The Boorara domain, in which tenement P27/1642 lies, is bounded by the Bardoc Shear Zone 
 to the west and the Mount Monger Fault to the east and is interpreted as the easternmost part of 
 the Kalgoorlie Terrane. This terrane is regarded as and originally coherent volcano-sedimentary 
 basin formed between 2.72 Ga and 2.68 Ga, and is characterised by a regional lithostratigraphy

11.text: The  climate  in  this  area  is  semiarid,  with  an  annual  rainfall  of  about 250  mm  and  annual

12.text: evaporation of about 2300mm. Open eucalyptus woodlands that consist mainly of salmon gums,

13.text: gimlet,  and  mallee,  interspersed  with  saltbush  and  bluebush  cover  the  flat  and  undulating

28.text: The  Four  Mile  Hill  tenements  lie  within  the  Kalgoorlie  Terrane  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn

29.text: Craton of Western Australia. The Kalgoorlie Terrane is situated centrally in the highly economic

30.text: [Ni  –Cu  –  (PGE),  Au]  Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn  Craton.  The

31.text: Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane  comprises  approximately  northnorthwest-  trending,  linear

32.text: greenstone  belts  of  metamorphosed  felsic,  mafic  and  ultramafic  volcanic  and  intrusive  rocks,

text:
Regional Geology  
 The  Four  Mile  Hill  tenements  lie  within  the  Kalgoorlie  Terrane  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn 
 Craton of Western Australia. The Kalgoorlie Terrane is situated centrally in the highly economic 
 [Ni  –Cu  –  (PGE),  Au]  Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane  of  the  Archaean  Yilgarn  Craton.  The 
 Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane  comprises  approximately  northnorthwest-  trending,  linear 
 greenstone  belts  of  metamorphosed  felsic,  mafic  and  ultramafic  volcanic  and  intrusive  rocks,

33.text: together with associated epiclastic, including volcaniclastic sedimentary rocks (Trofimovs, et. al,

34.text: 2006). The greenstone succession was emplaced primarily between 2720 and 2655 Ma. Granitic

35.text: intrusion  coincided  with  the  later  stages  of  greenstone  formation,  with  a  period  of  high-Ca

together with associated epiclastic, including volcaniclastic sedimentary rocks (Trofimovs, et. al,

 intrusion  coincided  with  the  later  stages  of  greenstone  formation,  with  a  period  of  high-Ca

10.text: Ultramafic-hosted  syngenetic  nickel  sulphide  deposits  are  common  throughout  the  Kalgoorlie

11.text: Terrane, with the greatest concentrations observed at Kambalda. Epigenetic gold mineralisation

12.text: is  also  common  (e.g.  Golden  Mile  belt,  Kalgoorlie).  The  gold  deposits  are  associated  with  a

13.text: variety of deformational and metamorphic regimes.

15.text: The Kalgoorlie Terrane exhibits a stratigraphy and deformational history distinct from that of

16.text: adjacent  terranes  in  the  Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane.  The  stratigraphy  of  the  Kalgoorlie

17.text: Terrane comprises the following units; lower basalt unit, komatiite unit, upper basalt unit, felsic

18.text: volcanic  and  sedimentary  unit,  and  polymictic  conglomerate  unit.  The  Kalgoorlie  Terrane  is

19.text: tectonically disrupted by  major shear zones into a number of domains characterised by minor

20.text: differences in regional stratigraphy (in particular the presence and extent of the upper basalt unit)

21.text: and variations in  style and distribution of  recognised  D1  structures.  The  Kalgoorlie Terrane is

22.text: subdivided  into  six  structural  –  stratigraphic  domains  that  are  separated  by  major  faults:

23.text: Coolgardie, Ora Banda, Kambalda, Boorara, Parker and Bullabulling (Figure 3.)

25.text: The Four Mile Hill Project tenements lie within the Boorara Domain (Figure 4).

text:
Ultramafic-hosted  syngenetic  nickel  sulphide  deposits  are  common  throughout  the  Kalgoorlie 
 Terrane, with the greatest concentrations observed at Kambalda. Epigenetic gold mineralisation 
 is  also  common  (e.g.  Golden  Mile  belt,  Kalgoorlie).  The  gold  deposits  are  associated  with  a 
 variety of deformational and metamorphic regimes. 
 The Kalgoorlie Terrane exhibits a stratigraphy and deformational history distinct from that of 
 adjacent  terranes  in  the  Eastern  Goldfields  Superterrane.  The  stratigraphy  of  the  Kalgoorlie 
 Terrane comprises the following units; lower basalt unit, komatiite unit, upper basalt unit, felsic 
 volcanic  and  sedimentary  unit,  and  polymictic  conglomerate  unit.  The  Kalgoorlie  Terrane  is 
 tectonically disrupted by  major shear zones into a number of domains characterised by minor 
 differences in regional stratigraphy (in particular the presence and extent of the upper basalt unit) 
 and variations in  style and distribution of  recognised  D1  structures.  The  Kalgoorlie Terrane is 
 subdivided  into  six  structural  –  stratigraphic  domains  that  are  separated  by  major  faults: 
 Coolgardie, Ora Banda, Kambalda, Boorara, Parker and Bullabulling (Figure 3.) 
 The Four Mile Hill Project tenements lie within the Boorara Domain (Figure 4).
